column5: The whole things a farse allowing 45 " Lake Trout with no picture etc. At least we know this 38" monster is real....    Congrats Raf !

In order to enter, you should have to take a pic of the fish, with your forum username and a peice of paper the time/date   Anyone could make up measurements if they want.  I am sure there are a few people on that list that just wanted to see their name on the internet, lol!

A 27 inch speck from Wilmot................COME ON!!!!!!!!!! At least make it beleivable! Makes me mad when I hear crap like this.It takes away from peoples accomplishments with real trophy fish. 36 inch walleye....NOT! 53 inch Pike NOT!!!!!! Hey Mepps guess we should have added 6 inches to our pike too! 29 inch largemouth........... do the math on that, they don't even come that long on the Stick Farm or other Trophy southern waters. I am going to submit my 22 inch perch this year!
That pretty much sums it up Bucktail.

I dont worry about other ppl's entries.  I know mine are genuine, and that's all that matters.  But you are right....I've never heard of a speck coming from the Wilmot...maybe it made a wrong turn at  Albuquerque???

DanC, I was thinking the same thing about Bountyhunter that it might be a steelhead but was not 100% sure. Your friend Beamish always enter some nice catches. I figure you didn't enter because the way they run it and we all here on the board have seen your pics.  It not all about the size (LOL) Cliff mention it best "it was just a honour to be nominated"
its a shame that some of these crazy catches take away from some of the good fish caught during the year

The 2006 In-Fisherman Region 2 ( southern us) catch and release bass.  Region 2 Mark S. Held Magruder L., GA 28" 11/28 1/2F Lucky Craft Pete Rosko Golf Course L., FL 27.125" 6/4 Crippled Herring/wht Pete Rosko Golf Course L., FL 26.25" 6/19 Erie Shiner Spinner/gld John Martins Lake Tarpon, FL 26" 1/29 D n/a J. Steve Crouch Big Shanty, GA 26" 3/22 1/2D XCalibur/ornge Hans Wentz Bay L., FL 25" 1/15 F+1 shiner Jimmy Chambers Big Shanty, GA 25" 4/20 jig & pig/blu-blk Chris Simonds Lake Istokpoga, FL 24.25" 1/28 D-1 live shiner/gld Cecil Lunsford Lake Fork, TX 24" 4/3 jig & Speed   I have a 24 inch  inch x 18 largemouth on the wall beside me that freaks me out. Its 7 lbs and change. I know this shouldnt bother me but it does. I grew up in quinte and 34 inch eye is the biggest I have ever seen close up yet every week from Oct to Feb28th someone is catching a 16 lb plus fish. I once saw a 36 inch eye I estimate in the Moira on a spawning run 20 years ago. Slayinem and my freind Chris's eyes are the 2 biggest I have seen east of the Missippi this year in print or the internet. CCMT 's is very close behind. Oh and the pike ................................................. 42.2 is the current record for Ontario Here is my 48 inch 29-31lb pike.....and that other fish is nearly 40% bigger.............................     My Freind Chris's 15.0lb  eye on a digital scale    Finally my 22 inch PB  smallie from simcoe this fall. Thanks Misfish for the spot!!!!     Dan has seen what a 25 inch spec looks like...it will blow your noodle when you see one like that. Even for Nipigon thats almost maxed out.  Done my rant on fish exaggeration for the year.. I do it once a year. Thanks for listening people!  And thanks to all the real sportsman out there that tell the truth!! Somehow they all seem to belong to this board! Keep it up guys!  darren
hold it...hold it did some people say walleye can't be 36" or bigger.......  you had better look at the one in my avatar
Isn't that a ling in 'eye clothing....
no  sheephead     you had to know that
I was bein nice... Ling's eatable at least....
Terry  Didnt say they cant be, just that one over 36 is an EXTREMELY rare fish! People throw these numbers around like they are caught every week. Thats an awesome fish dude!
ok then I was just checking......LOL and you are right they are very rare and I doubt most  of the entries well except cliff and fishindevil and Barnie's Band of gold\and other OFNers

Bucktail, I think your pic with the smallmouth is one of the holes that I fish. If it's the same one, the average bass there are good size and sometimes they are stack and other time they come and go.
Didn't want to start any controversy with OFNers Terry...are you feeling ok?? LOL.
terry how long is this carp?
On my screen.. I measure it at 0.75 inches.
I edited my reply on page one to include Crazyhook...LOL  Guess my eyesight is going in my old age...

I can't believe nobody has touched on the fact that 90% of the "cohos" are dirty old chinooks.  The Fishing Canada contest at least required a measurement picture that some people still took advantage of by holding the tape measure well behind the fish to add on like 6" (ie. Gary Hodge). The only way to do it properly, in my opinion, is to have a measurement shot with a name brand measuring tape on a level surface. I understand that there aren't really any prizes so they don't care if people lie, but if half of the entries are fake, what's the point in running the awards at all?

Here's one from quinte last winter not a great pic but it was huge I estimated 14lbs. I was amazed at the size was only kept because it was bleeding profusely from gills. I still think that santa won with his 30lb zander LOL.

I was looking at the list and I spied Fishndevil on the Salmon list.  Congrats!!  Click the picture to get full sized....still hard to read the names so get out your magnifying glass!!  I'll try and rescan later on tonight....
no but I am glad they don't have a sheephead category..  .nuff said
lol terry
i see JPD for carp
To be on that list.. id have to catch fish...
Details details....
Hey Cliff are you and Bly on there for walleye??  I can't read the list!!  It looks like the biggest walleye was 36"?!?!  Hard to believe.....
I ended up tied for 4th for walleye and tied for 4th for carp.  Bly missed out on this years list by a mere half inch for walleye.
Congrats!!  Awesome catch, I remember it from your report.  You guys are the King and Queen of big walleye!!
Yes im there for a big king salmon !!!!.  ..thanks for posting cliff....cheers    congrats to you as well,and all the other OFC'ers too !!!
WOOHOO!! I'm on the list!   for Black Crappie of course.

Thats a great program that they have going, especially to get children involved in fishing.  The only problem that I see with it is the people putting outrageous sizes and there, with no pictures to prove at all and they accept it.

Cliff, here is a part listing from the 2007 results and most with pics. Congrats to all OFC'er!  http://www.ontarioanglerawards.com/Entries.cfm?FishID=17 Ccmtcanada-33 1/2" Walleye  http://www.ontarioanglerawards.com/Entries.cfm?FishID=11 Fishindevil-43" Chinook Salmon  http://www.ontarioanglerawards.com/Entries.cfm?FishID=9 BBoG aka Barnie-15 1/2" Black Crappie  http://www.ontarioanglerawards.com/Entries.cfm?FishID=1 JPD-38" Carp  http://www.ontarioanglerawards.com/Entries.cfm?FishID=12 Smallmouth Bass  http://www.ontarioanglerawards.com/Entries.cfm?FishID=3 Muskie  http://www.ontarioanglerawards.com/Entries.cfm?FishID=4 Pike  http://www.ontarioanglerawards.com/Entries.cfm?FishID=13 Brook Trout-27 1/2" near Bancroft and 27" from Wilmot Creek  WOW!! Those are some big brookie and not from up North.  DanC, do you ever enter yours?
Goal for 2008  Get on the Top 10 Hit List for 1 specie.
If only mud puppies, gobies, bikes and cell phones were there............
I caught a fishing rod once (by the top eyelet while trolling) - but a BIKE - you get first prize
I see a few OFNers in the carp categorie...Photoz, Uncle Buck, Ccmt, Blyght, Crazyhook...  Goran is making good use of his new carp equipment...
I cant belive my pike didnt make the list!

Nice fish guys. Honestly, though cliff, I think a tie for first or second is more accurate. The second place fish is listed as 35 inches with a 10 inch girth......sounds more like an eel. As for the others...some people either got funny measuring tapes or have trouble converting from metric.
My 45 incher 25-30lbs(estimated, didnt actually measure it - although i estimated on the shorter side, its probably closer to 47inches)   and the winning 53 incher, 43lbs...   hmmmm...

No I don't enter such competitions Nelly. My Brook Trout typically top out at around 23 inches each year. Beamish, who is a friend if mine is on the list a few times. His entries are in that range. The Wilmot fish looks suspicious to me. I've never seen a Brookie with bright pink cheeks before. Check out Bountyhunters 25" fish. Is that not a Steelhead??
Yeah those are some crazy fish at the top, 53" pike, 36" walleye, those are some monsters. Seeing that picture though, that is one long pike. Nice fish guys.

I'm not worried about it Rick....all my fish measurements are accurate + or - 6 to 8 inches. LOL.  I'm kidding of course.  Because it's done on the honour system, there will always be inaccuracies.  In short, it was an honour just to be nominated....
I am on the carp list!
Go on the website and check out the biggest bass of the year. I need to buy one of their measuring tapes  Check out 2006 as well biggest largemouth was almost 29" I'd like to find that hole!
